name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Orton Hall Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst accepting the other comments of slightly outdated decor, its surroundings were so lovely that we ignored this fact and decided to stay at the hotel when we arrived, We thought that the staff were efficient and helpful, if not overly friendly, and were impressed by the warmth and comfort of the pool despite the steam room not working during our stay. Dinner was good, and so was breakfast, and at first glance, our room was very comfortable and spacious. It was only at 04::00 that we discovered there were drawbacks to its location in the new block. Rowdy Scots next door neighbours with an addition to smoking arrived back their room tanked up on alcohol, and proceeded to go in and out to the exterior through the variety of doors, to light up and to chat. Every door closure, every movement, every (foul languaged) word was relayed to us in our own room, as if they were right there with us sitting on the bed. Whilst we don't blame the hotel for the nature of its residents, they do have a duty of care to ensure their guests have a night's sleep, if that is they want, and are not kept up through poor attention to acoustics, by those who don't want to sleep. Bleary eyed we made our way to the Duty Manager the following morning, who obligingly listened to what we had to say and considerately knocked £25 off our bill. That didn't actually make much difference to the fact that ultimately, we would not stay again!
reviews.title: A MIXTURE OF EXPERIENCES.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel - it is historic and beautiful with so much to explore. It is certainly not a run of the mill experience. Our room was very spacious. clean and comfortable so we were highly delighted andit was also on the ground floor as requested in a quiet location.
reviews.title: Superb in everyway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The real highlight for us was in the restaurant - our meal was wonderful and for 3 courses at £30 per head it very good value for such quality. Superb service too and we will be thank you for making our stay so memorable for all the right reasons!!
reviews.title: Stunning building, friendly staff and excellent food!

reviews.text: We stayed at The Orton Hall Hotel in February 2011 as our friends were getting married there. We found this to be a lovely hotel, very friendly staff in all areas and the food was excellent.
reviews.title: At last a UK Hotel with Excellent Customer Service

reviews.text: We ate in The Huntly Restaurant the night we arrived which was excellent, its not cheap, but well worth every penny.
reviews.title: 80's throw back

reviews.text: Stayed one night for a family function, including dinner, breakfast and lunch. No problems with the accommodation, but the catering arrangements need to be taken in hand seriously. We had arranged for the party to have dinner at 7.30, but our orders were not taken until after 8, and eventually coffee arrived after prompting at 10.40. It is not clear whether there were too many diners - there was also a wedding party - or whether there were simply not enough staff in the kitchen, or serving.
reviews.title: catering needs to be taken in hand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some of our party did not even attempt breakfast because of the sheer numbers around.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.text: As for the buffet lunch - have you ever been served hot potato wedges which had to be picked up BY HAND? Cutlery there was none.
reviews.title: nice hotel, uncomfortable beds

reviews.text: We have just spent 3 great nights here and it was fantastic!
reviews.title: Just Perfect!

reviews.text: perfect and clean rooms, friendly staff and a fabulous setting. We did"nt use the hotel restaurant but used the pub situated in the grounds, great food reasonably priced, very friendly staff and full of locals which to me shows how good it is.We used the hotel as a base for a fishing and shopping break.I would recommend taking a short walk across the road to the mere , very peaceful. We have stayed at other hotels in the area but will definately be comming back here.
reviews.title: Hostel Like

likes.disliked: — the worn out beds and furniture

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night and enjoyed the experience. The hotel room was large, clean and very comfortable. We had supper in the bar and although the food was good, the bar area was slightly scruffy. Breakfast was good although the waitress was rather snappy. I didn't sit where I was told and had to move!! Apart from that, no problems at all and would return here if we were in Peterborough again.
reviews.title: Pleasant Night's Stay!

likes.disliked: — Staff could do with a little more training!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our wedding reception here on June 28th 2008and also stayed the night before heading off on our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Excellant Room & Fantastic Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off all of the staff were fantastic and very attentive. The food at the reception was first class and all of our guests commented on how wonderful the food was.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

likes.disliked: — slightly cheapened by the pub next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room; 'The honeymoon Suite' was very nice. A large LCD/Plasma, an excellent en suite and a very comfortable bed!
reviews.title: shame about the fire alarm

reviews.text: I would most definitely recommend The Best Western OHH to friends and family.
reviews.title: Fantastic food, excellent service and a great room!

reviews.text: We stayed here visiting family for 4 nights, this hotel seems to mainly cater to the business conference & wedding market which is understandable as I guess Peterborough is not the usual tourist hotspot and this was reflected in the hotel service e.g. the breakfast room is deserted after 9am & they were preparing for lunch every morning but as we were on holiday we had breakfast late & the staff were always busy elsewhere. Otherwise the rooms were clean if a little dated(1970's T.V.s & not many channels), all of the staff from reception,house keeping & in the restaurant were very friendly & proffessional . The pool was one of the nicest I have found in this type of hotel a decent size,clean, warm & empty.The restaurant food quite honestly is mediocre but we stayed last year & it was terrible so we were relatively happy.
reviews.title: no complaints, good value,very nice pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With three star hotels in the UK you never really know what to expect. Like many this place has a feeling of faded grandeur – it really could be something special but it does not quite hit the mark. Currently it appears to be majoring in on the conference and wedding circuit – always a dodgy sign.
reviews.title: Faded grandeur - yet again!

reviews.text: On the plus side there is what looks to be a brand new leisure club. Good facilities: small gym, jacuzzi, stream room, sauna and good size pool. Very airy and spotlessly clean – definitely the strength of the hotel. Parts of the building also have real character and the grounds are leafy and pleasant. The bedrooms while a bit dated are clean enough and of a good size.
reviews.title: Orton Hall hmmmm

reviews.text: This aside though the hotel has a tired feeling to it. When we arrived on Sunday afternoon there were trays with the remnants of spent tea and empty drinks glasses dotted around. We had a drink in the conservatory on arrival at 5.00pm, and the empties had still not been cleared when we went to bed at 11.00! Seeing the poor standard of housekeeping – which I took to be emblematic of wider problems – I was unwilling to gamble £27.00 on the table d’hote dinner (£4.95 supplement for the roast!). When will UK hoteliers ever learn? Such problems cost nothing to put right but can make all the difference in terms of repeat bookings. Day rooms, while once clearly rather special, now need some attention. Consider ,for example, the conservatory. The beautiful stained glass windows deserve to be complemented by much finer furniture. Could someone explain to me why the very large scratched and worn mahogany table in situ was not despatched to a skip years ago! Most of the furniture in the rather pretentiously named ‘Drawing Room’ has similarly seen far better days. Tatty doors giving guests views into the kitchen also seem to abound for some reason!? In sum, if you get a late deal as we did at a budget price it’s OK. But don’t pay over the odds or use it for any sort of special occasion
reviews.title: Nice enough Hotel with leisure facilities
Nice hotel
reviews.text: After spending a night here i have very mixed reviews. Rooms are very old and dated and beds very uncomfortable. Pool area and pub across road nice. Staff not very friendly had to sit in reception for a while and listen to them moaning about customers a lot , i think they probably wish that they didnt have any as customers seem to cause them too many problems! !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in May in an Executive Double room. Was a nice sized room with a view of the garden. No complaints at all about the room and its facilities; plenty of tea, coffee, shower gels etc and TV had a decent selection of channels.
reviews.title: Very pretty location, nice hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel grounds & original building were beautiful and there was a lot that could be explored.
reviews.title: Average hotel at above average prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel facilities were good - indoor pool area was clean and quiet and the breakfast room OK. I'd recommend eating breakfast in the conservatory area though if possible - less crowded and light & pretty. Top Tip - the toasters there were SLOW so get that first, or the rest of your breakfast will go cold!!
reviews.title: One of the best hotel experiences we've had in UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was that a wedding was taking place there, leaving the bar area a bit of a no-go for other guests during the evening. Some party guests also came and went from their rooms loudly very late at night! If you're a sound sleeper, you probably wouldn't notice & I wouldn't let this put you off a stay here.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel our family and friends enjoyed

reviews.text: There's a bar attached and it's only a 5-10 minute drive to the centre of Peterborough, so a good hotel overall.
reviews.title: Great Hotel !! Best out of the 26 I have stayed in this year

reviews.text: I have previously reviewed this hotel, the last time in December 2009. I have stayed there on many occasions, mainly due to the location and its handiness for business appointments. This time, the rooms allocated to me and my business colleagues were poor with one colleague complaining of paper thin walls meaning that he thought his neighbour was showering in his room. I found the attitude on the front desk to be almost 'couldn't care less'. On balance, the great variation in the quality and experience offered by Orton Hall means that I will seek elsewhere for a regular Peterborough hotel. A shame but I feel the managers here need to get a grip on quality and standards quickly.
reviews.title: VERY MIXED EXPERIENCES AT THIS HOTEL

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for three nights with my husband - we were on a course that was running in their business rooms.
reviews.title: Average hotel with beautiful grounds

reviews.text: First impressions were good - the hotel grounds are lovely (though we weren't there for pleasure, so didn't get to enjoy them much unfortunately). The room was okay - clean and provided all the necessities. The old fashioned decor which wasn't to our taste at all.
reviews.title: Squeaky floorboard with paper thin walls

reviews.text: The staff we dealt with were good overall. Before we'd arrived I'd called to make sure our room wouldn't be on the top floor as there's no lift, and I was heavily pregnant. The staff member I spoke to efficiently carried out this request. The heating wasn't working in our room and one of our drawers broken when we arrived. However the duty manager came up promptly to check the heating (very pleasant guy), sent up appropriate heating when it still didn't work and the drawer was fixed the following day.
reviews.title: Great place for a wedding.

reviews.text: We weren't too impressed with the restaurant; while breakfast was good with a wide choice, when we were presented with the same menu we'd had on the first night on our second day I questioned it. I was told it only changed EVERY MONTH - the same menu every night! Not good. Good thing we were able to eat in the pub too. I had a tasteless sauce with my pasta and salmon, while my husband had an average tasting dish of pork and chips.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: This hotel has one of the nicest swimming pools I have encountered in a hotel, the reception staff are efficient & friendly and the rooms are a nice size although a little dated.
reviews.title: Will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the downside the breakfast is no longer freshly cooked & is a badly prepared greasy buffet style now. As with previous visits the temp. or new restaurant staff had no idea, at breakfast I was sat at a dirty previously used table with no butter etc, the breakfast buffet was not regularly refilled and the young staff were more interested in preparing for lunch rather than serving the guests onhand.
reviews.title: Great Hotel at a great price

reviews.text: Being a Best Western Rewards member we had an upgraded room in the original building which was biggg and comfortable though not air conditioned.
reviews.title: Good quality Hotel, excellent facilities

reviews.text: However with the windows open it was fine.
reviews.title: The On Site Pub called the Bramblewood Inn is a dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast ranks amongst the best hotel ones that I have had (which is quite a lot!)
reviews.title: Amazing wedding!

reviews.text: Not your usual Best Western, this hotel is set in lovely grounds. It seems to have been built around a grand mid-Victorian property with castle pretensions, but our rooms were modern (we had two, a double for ourselves and a single for the son next door) had all the amenities, and were sparkling clean.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay - recommended!
The Wedding of M & L Bass
reviews.text: We ate a delicious meal in the restaurant, and although one of the lounges was closed for a private party ( and this must happen often, as the venue is extremely popular for weddings and receptions) this didn't impact on our stay at all. Breakfast was also extremely pleasant, overlooking the extensive grounds.
If we stay in or near Peterborough again we would be glad to return here!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: I was looking on the internet to find a venue to hold my sisters wedding. My sister lives on the outskirts of Peterborough, and I live and work in Devon. I'd phoned through to many hotels in the Peterborough area and was after a venue with charm and old worldy character, I had not had any success until I happened upon the Orton Hall Hotel website which looked as if it had it all.
reviews.title: Really enjoy it, everytime i stay

reviews.text: The conservatory where the wedding took place could have easily been mistaken for a church as it had some stain glass windows and internal stonework. The Hotel Staff were pleasant, and polite, you couldnt ask for a much better venue......
reviews.title: Oldy Worldy without the charm
